body.p:
Covington Ky March 29th 1864
To His Excellency Governor Bramlett

Your petitioner would respectfully represent to your Honour that at the present session of the Kenton Circuit Court he was fined the sum of $200.00/100 Keeping a gambling house. but upon the proof it was assertained that some young men came in and played for a treat and after they had played the Liquor was bought and paid for by the looser & this was all of the case and under the instructions of the court he was found as above.

He further states that at the same time on the same day and by the same jury he was fined fifty dollars for selling in his Tavern Liquor to a Minor who Swore that he had a berd 2 inches long whin he purcharsed the Liquor. Wherefore your Petitioner in prays that your Honour would use your Clemency remit so much of the said fine as you are authorised to do, and your petitioner will Ever pray

We the undersigned were on the jury that true the case of the Comw'th vs Peter Merigan and respectfully join him in his Petition as above, as We believe he did not intend to violate the law in Either case wherefore we join in the above Petition

Names of Juror
E. G. Clarkson (fore)
Elijah Yates
W. J. Hyde
Arthur Craig
Names of Jurors
Wm Wiley
J Fletcher
J M Mead
James Riddle
Names of Jurors
F. Dorman
J. R. Mills.
John Steffon
I Certify that the foregoing names are ^among^ those that were on the jury when Peter Merigan was fined as states in the foregoing Petition

Att B W Foley Clerk
By A. C. Ellis D C

The proof in the cases referred to is substantially Stated in the petition and the juror with one exception have Signed the petition. The defendant is a poor man and the amount of the two fines is a large sum for him to pay He is a German and has a little country Tavern and upon the whole I think the fines should be remitted

Please direct to S. C. Perrin
Covington
Ky
S C Perrin
Atty at Law
